vertical or horizontal pole or frame

four sturdy legs with hooved toes

pedals typically located near the front wheel
a frame that includes a seat for the rider

a mounting plate or head for attaching a camera or other device

frequently depicted in white or other bright colors
often depicted with a flowing mane and tail

buttons and controls on the front panel (e.g., play, stop, rewind)

input ports for connecting to other devices (HDMI, VGA, USB)

Hour, minute, and possibly second hands

textured or smooth surface on the rind
green rind with dark green stripes or spots

often used for carrying heavy loads

materials such as wood, metal, or concrete

bars of varying lengths (longer bars produce lower pitches, shorter bars produce higher pitches)

a fuselage (the main body of the airplane)
